p: Regarding toxicological studies, it has been reported that a single oral administration of enhydrin ( 1) at doses of 1.6, 4 and 8 mg/kg body weight (b.w.) did not caused deaths or acute toxic effects within 7 days in male and female rats ( Genta et al., 2010). In acute study in rats, there were no deaths or signs of toxicity observed after single oral administration of 1 at any dose level up to the highest dose tested (0.32 g/kg b.w.) within 14 days. In subchronic studies, after oral administration for 90 days at daily doses of 0.4, 0.8 and 8.0 mg/kg b.w., did not caused hematological, biochemical and histological alterations in rats ( Serra et al., 2012).
